content.title: Financial Assistance to Take up Value Addition to Seafood
content.beneficiary: Individuals interested in setting up a unit for value-added fisheries products
content.details: Financial Assistance to Take up Value Addition to Seafood is a scheme by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Goa. Through this scheme, individuals who have been residents of Goa for the last 15 years, and are interested in setting up a unit for value-added fisheries products are provided financial assistance as a subsidy of 50% of the cost for the Construction or Renovation of the Unit or for the Purchase of Equipment. The applications are accepted only in offline mode.
benefits: 50% subsidy of the cost for Construction or Renovation of the Unit, limited to ₹5,00,000 per unit.
50% subsidy of the cost for Purchase of Equipment, limited to ₹2,00,000 per unit.
eligibility: The applicant should be an individual interested in setting up a unit for value-added fisheries products.
The applicant should be a resident of Goa for the last 15 years.
Preference will be given to self-help groups, women entrepreneurs, and youth who have completed fishermen training courses/short-term training programs conducted by the Directorate of Fisheries.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should request the prescribed format of the application form from the department, fill in all mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all mandatory documents before submitting to the concerned authority.
documents_required: Proof of Availability of Land/Ownership Documents
For Self-Help Group - Group Registration Documents

faqs.question: What is the website link for accessing the guidelines and Citizen Charter related to the scheme?
Are there any specific training programs that enhance the chances of selection for youth applicants?
faqs.answer: Youth who have completed fishermen training courses/short-term programs by the Directorate of Fisheries receive preference.

faqs.question: What does the financial assistance cover for the purchase of equipment under the scheme?
faqs.answer: 50% subsidy of the cost, limited to ₹2,00,000 per unit.

faqs.question: Can the application be submitted online, and what is the contact information for submitting it offline?
faqs.answer: No, applications are accepted only offline. Submit the form and documents to the Directorate of Fisheries or BDO Office/Sub-Offices.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee for the scheme, and where can applicants find the prescribed format for the application form?
faqs.answer: No application fee. The prescribed format is available on the Department's website: https://fisheries.goa.gov.in/schemes-services/

faqs.question: How can applicants ensure their complaints are acknowledged, and what is the expected timeline for resolution?
faqs.answer: Complaints can be lodged at dir-fish.goa@nic.in, and all complaints will be acknowledged. Final action communicated within 30 days.

faqs.question: What are the mandatory documents required for the application process?
faqs.answer: Detailed Project Report, Proof of Land/Ownership, Identity Proof, Residence Certificate for 15 Years, and relevant documents for groups.

faqs.question: Could you explain the grievance redressal process for dissatisfaction or complaints?
faqs.answer: Register complaints with the Grievance Redressal Officer or via dir-fish.goa@nic.in. All complaints will be acknowledged, and action communicated within 30 days.

faqs.question: Are there any preferences given to certain groups during the selection process?
faqs.answer: Preference is given to self-help groups, women entrepreneurs, and youth who have completed specific fisheries training programs.

faqs.question: Can you clarify the application mode and deadline for submissions?
faqs.answer: The application mode is offline, and there is no specified deadline for submissions.

faqs.question: What is the maximum subsidy provided for the Construction or Renovation of the unit under the scheme?
Is there a specific age limit for applicants under the scheme, and are there any considerations for Persons with Disabilities (PwDs)?
faqs.answer: No age-related criteria, and there are no specific criteria for PwDs.
